curam.util.persistence.validation.customizable.validator
Interface NumberValidator

public interface NumberValidator

Validator methods for numeric primitive types.

The methods verify that the validation with supplied ValidationContext is enabled before performing the check.

If the validation is enabled, the methods perform the check. If the check is successful, the methods return true. If the check is unsuccessful, the methods flag to the error handling infrastructure that the validation has been unsuccessful, and then return false.

If the validation is disabled, the methods all return true.

Method Summary

Method Detail

equals

boolean equals(ValidationContext ctx,
               AppException appException,
               double value,
               double expected)
Validates that the supplied double value is equal to the other supplied double value.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
value - The value to check.
expected - The expected value.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.

notEquals

boolean notEquals(ValidationContext ctx,
                  AppException appException,
                  double value,
                  double other)
Validates that the supplied double value is not equal to the other supplied double value.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
value - The value to check.
other - The other value - that is, the value to which it is not expected the supplied value will be equal.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

notEquals

                  AppException appException,
                  double value,
                  double other,
                  double tolerance)

Parameters:

appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
value - The value to check.
other - The other value - that is, the value to which it is not expected that the supplied value will be equal within the supplied tolerance.
tolerance - The tolerance.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.
